title: College seniors confidence interval for proportion

content.question: A survey was conducted to determine what percentage of college seniors would have chosen to attend a different college if they had known then what they know now. In a random sample of 100 seniors, 34 percent indicated that they would have attended a different college. A 90 percent confidence interval for the percentage of all seniors who would have attended a different college is

topic.text: 6.2: Constructing a Confidence Interval for a Population Proportion

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Construct a confidence interval, provided conditions for inference are met.
